heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 08 October 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (186°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 7.6°C), outside temperature (down 6.5°C), and inside temperature (down 3.1°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 7%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 553 m) and light levels (up 2765 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 3367 lux) and cloud levels (up 528 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 552.6m lower than yesterday, 394.0m lower than the past week, 528.5m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 993m and a peak of 2630m, averaging 1069.9m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; chilly temperatures are forecasted. Also, the atmosphere will feel parched and dry and very little to no wind will be present. A few light raindrops may fall, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and bright intervals likely. High pressure suggests settled weather.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
